page.title: 01LOOKING AT THE WEST WIGHT
page.content: The West Wight is a beautiful area. It is the most westerly point of the diamond shaped island.There is lots of countryside.It is the most attractive place on the island.The Warren has lots of rabbits and is a great big grassy area.There are lots of Gorse bushes with big prickles.The Warren has lots of heather bushes and it's very springy.Near the end there is a beautiful view of the Needles lighthouse and Alum Bay.There is an especially nice tea room down at Alum Bay.The area is very beautiful.The beach is stoney but it is most enjoyable for many people of all kinds.It is a very good place for finding crystals and fossils.There are 231 steps down to the beach and there are very high cliffs. Jane Elton 9 years
